question: Do you support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution? Please answer briefly in 2–3 sentences.

comments.comment: I am pretty conflicted, but I think overall I think its okay to accept refugees fleeing war or persecution. I know if I was in their shoes, I would want somewhere safe to go.
Yes I support the US government accepting more refugees who are fleeing persecution that would result in harm including loss of life
I do support the government accepting more refugees because they are people who didn’t choose to live that war, people who is trying to have a better life for them and their families

I believe the government should accept refugees fleeing dangerous situations. However, the qualifications for what justifies refugee status should be thoroughly vetted. There should also be limits in place so that citizens do not experience negative effects on their quality of life.

If america was a wealthy nation and could take care of refugees then I would say it's the right thing to do. However, america isn't rich, it has more debt than it can pay back and can't help it's own citizens. No, we shouldn't accept more refugees till we can take care of our own.

I find that I do support the government doing this. The reason being is that why have an abundance of resources if you are not using it. I find that no matter, where you are born that you deserve kindness and deserve a good life and so accepting people that are looking to achieve that seems ideal to me.

I do not support the immigration policy/refugee policy because it is taking away from average every day americans and increasing the strain on our systems and society. Many Americans who can use there resources are flat out denied whereas people who've come here illegally receive this aid and its bullshit to me,.
Yes i do. But i think there should be more vetting of these refugees and education on rules of the society and how to intergrate into American Society.
Yes, innocent children and parents are being killed. Every life matters.

No because most of the time they tend to increase in number with time which in turn impacts the government expenditure on them. The government needs to cater for the social needs and share resources with them.

I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution, however, only after they have been thoroughly vetted. I think it is great the our country can help other people escape poverty, but we cannot just let any people in and there has to be somewhat of a limit on the number of people as we still have plenty of problems here that need to be solved for current citizens.
Yes. I am Native American and want my ancestors' land to be ours again.

I do believe our government should show compassion by accepting refugees fleeing war and persecution, since they are trying to escape life-threatening situations. But I also think our government should ensure a balanced approach in helping, but making sure citizens have access to enough resources to thrive, and not having both citizens and refugees compete for resources.

While I strongly believe in human rights and have compassion for those who suffer, I think the government should continue accepting refugees. However, there should be rigorous vetting processes in place to prevent individuals with criminal backgrounds or questionable pasts from entering our country.
I would why that I the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution. I think that this is a good thing to do.

I think it depends, but I do support governments accepting genuine refugees in these situations. However, I specifically want to exclude economic migrants and criminals from being allowed in under these pretenses.

I support the government accepting refugees. I think that the cities are becoming too crowded, but many rural areas of the US would benefit from an increased population. Similar to during the Vietnam and Korean wars, there are opportunities to open up refugee camps in less populated areas to help increased population and teach skills to help boost economies.
Yes I am okay with it as long as it doesn’t affect our economy.  If it goes negative I don’t want it.

Yes I do support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution especially when it is a direct result of our governments foreign policy. This country and many others were founded on the idea of fleeing persecution and fighting for individual liberties. Also, to accept refugees means more cultural diversity which can greatly benefit our nation.

Yes, I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution because they need safety and a chance to rebuild their lives. Offering refuge is a humanitarian responsibility that helps protect human rights and promotes global solidarity.

Yes! We should never negate helping those fleeing dangerous places as we are a nation which is supposed to take in the poor, people from all nations and provide them with a place where they can feel safe
I do not. The should flee to other countries that connect the theirs. They are all travelling thousands of miles to come here. It's overwhelming.

The bare minimum the US can do for refugees is to give them shelter and protection, this country does enough damage to other countries for no reason other than "peacekeeping." Not to mention directly supplying Israel for more than just this presidency, this country is full of sin for these refugees and persecuted individuals. We as a country must give them a place to call home or a shelter away from danger.

I am on the fence about supporting and not supporting. I do believe everyone should have a safe place to run to but I also do not believe we should just be letting anyone into the United States. I believe that there are stipulations, processes, and vetting that should be done to accept refugees.

I am support of the government allowing more refugees fleeing war or persecution, as long as they do not pose a risk to the safety of our country, nor have criminal backgrounds. Most refugees are suffering with basic human rights, so it is only fair to help them escape such treacherous conditions.

I do support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution. People shouldn't have to fear for their lives constantly and should be allowed to take refuge in another country. Everybody on Earth who has is not an evil person has the right to live a good life.
I support accepting more refugees. If our country has the means to provide support for these people fleeing for safety and survival, why should we turn them away?
Generally no. There are conflicts all over the world and we have enough issues going on at home. Only in some extreme circumstance.
Yes, I think we should welcome refugees. They are fleeing war, and if saving them means they come here I am for it.
Yes, I think the government should take in more refugees. They are running away from war and danger, and they need a safe place to live. Helping them is the right and kind thing to do.
I support the cause because it is the write thing to do. These people are innocent. It shows how great and caring our government is.

I support accepting refugees. I can't support allowing people to suffer if we have the means to support if it isn't a detriment to everyone involved. Make better accomodations for them and address the problem.
i believe that america should be open to the idea of accepting refugees.we should be a safe place for freedom
I do not. I think that they are coming in too fast for us to vet their background properly.
Yes I do, nobody should be forced to be in a situation where they are in danger or persecuted. It is important that everyone is safe

I support tha government taking in refugees, although I do worry about what consequences it would bring both to the refugees and to us. I think it is important for our nation to show that they care about individuals.

I believe we should welcome more refugees escaping war and persecution because everyone deserves a chance to live safely and with dignity. Opening our doors shows kindness and helps people rebuild their lives after facing unimaginable hardship.
I'm not sure about this. We don't want to say no to people who really need the help but at the same time we as US Citizens need a lot of help as well.

I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution as long as they have been searched and cleared. I do believe there are some bad actors or criminals in the mix so everyone needs to be checked, not everyone is good, but I do believe as well that the majority are good and innocent people who are just feeling from a bad situation.

I do not support the government accepting more refugees.  I morally think we should but America is currently not in the position to be accepting refugees.  We need to work on our internal problems first.
No, we already have too many immigrants. They need to figure out to make their homeland better,
I find it an acceptable practice as long as priority is given to African nations as they then to receive the less support from the United States.
I accept more refugees fleeing war and persecution.  Our country needs to show compassion for people in need and dire circumstances.  We should serve as an example for other countries to follow.
I strongly support government accepting refugees fleeing wars. It’s just the matter of humanity to reduce death and suffering by letting them in. We owe each other basic humanity.

Yes, because the United States was born from citizens escaping harsh conditions and tyrannical rule. Despite the country's flaws, we are still an honorable country for those in need to rely on when their own country is in ruin.

I support our government accepting more refugees fleeing war and/or persecution. I think there is no other nation as capable as ours that can handle a large amount of refugees and we only stand to gain from doing so. I feel that by accepting refugees we set an example to rest of the world in how to act as a powerful nation and that we still deserve our spot as peacekeepers. These refugees will also be very grateful for giving them a second chance at life and will become great citizens.
I do not support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution. We most take care of our own people and there are many individuals her who need hello.

I think the US has a lot going on with their own citizens. The people here are already struggling to survive and you're bringing more people here and they are getting more help than the people who was born here who are struggling. At the same time I feel for them. I just don't understand why they all flee here when there are other countries.

You should support anyone fleeing death or prosecution with open arms. Given that the person doesn't have a criminal history or a background of violence there's no reason not to allow them into your country.

I do support the government accepting refugees fleeing hard times. Out of compassion for humans, we should come to their aid. As a wealthy, benevolent nation, full of resources to help others, we should be willing to help these individuals. We can be innovative and help these individuals.

I support the government accepting more refugees into the country to an extent. While I support refugees seeking a safe haven to escape war, I also feel strong immigration policies need to be implemented so that background checks or other procedures are implemented to help protect the country from allowing people into the country that have a criminal background or belong to a criminal group. There also needs to be a procedure for naturalization or time frame of return to the original country.

Yes, I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution because we have a moral duty to help these people. Turning a blind eye devalues us a country. Not helping these people is condoning atrocities and not supporting growth and potential each person has.
Of course. 9 times out of 10 we're partially responsible for these wars either by funding them or not getting involved which is a bystander effect. The least we could do is accept refugees.

Absolutely we should be accepting refugees. This country was founded and built on and by the need and brilliance of refugees.  It is ridiculous to think we should stop allowing people to enter the country that our ancestors (unless we are Native American) came to.
Yes I do support them. I believe that humans shouldn't have to live in these situations as life itself is already hard enough.
Yes, I believe the government should help people escaping war or bad treatment. these people are in danger and need a safe place to go and they don't deserve to suffer due to political disagreement.

This is a tough question because the immigration system is already overwhelmed, and there are many "refugees" who are not actual refugees fleeing war but rather taking advantage of the system. There is no good answer, but the system needs to be put on hold until it is fixed and the bad actors are out.
Yes, I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution. It is the humane and right thing to do to help fellow human beings if their lives are legitimately in danger.

I absolutely think we should accept as many refugees as possible. We are one of the wealthiest countries in the world and we have a moral obligation to help everyone that we can. It's frustrating to me that a lot of people in my country not only feel that we should turn the refugees away but they even talk bad about them, and it's almost always people who base everything on their religion. It's maddening. I think we should do everything we can to help any human less fortunate than us.

In the US, we have a huge immigration issue over the last couple of years, because there are many undocumented people allowed in the US. In our country, everyone should be accounted for, and registered as a citizen. I don't have any issues with refugees, if they come into our country and file for citizenship legitimately.

I support the government accepting more refugees, but only if it doesn't put an greater strain on the country. I think that we should be willing to help those that are innocent and seeking asylum from bad circumstances.
I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war, I think safety should be the top priority above everything else.
I support the government accepting refugees.  People have the right to live their lives away from war and persecution.

I do support the government accepting more refugees. I believe this will allow us to have better relations with other countries, and it is good to give back to those in need. They are also likely to help increase diversity and generate income or jobs once they get their footing here.

I feel like the US should be open to accepting new refugees, however, they should be vetted and provided documentation.  They should also be subject o followup visits and abide by all the laws of the US.  If they break the law, they go home.
Yes. I believe that all borders should be abolished. People have total freedom of movement. We are a single species and we cannot have such divisions amongst us.

No, I do not support more refugees. We have enough people in this country and with the wide influx of immigrants that Biden let into our country, it's caused nothing but chaos, crime and health issues for Americans.

Yes I support it. This is a nation built on immigration, and we preach democracy, freedom, and justice. I feel it is important we uphold these values and extend our good fortune as a powerful nation to help others who need it the most. If we show good will towards others I hope it would come back to us as being good role models and having positive relationships with many other nations.

I don't currently think we need to accept more refugees. Our country is in a lot of debt and many of our own citizens are struggling. We need to prioritize ourselves for now and not take on more than we can handle.

Yes, I think governments should help those most in need. This is especially true and important if the conflict was brought about by the country itself. Of course, the messaging will be important to make it more acceptable to everyday citizens and not risk backlash.

I think that, in many cases, it is the responsibility of the United States to accept these refugees.  Often the turmoil in these countries that necessitated refugees fleeing them was caused, at least in part, by the United States and we need to help those we have negatively affected

I greatly support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war and persecution because we should be welcoming and helping those in need. We need to show empathy for people in extreme situations and we have the means to help them.

No I don’t support allowing more refugees to enter our country. I believe the US has let too many people into the country and it has been a drain on our resources. I think in a lot of instances people are willing to say they are fleeing their country and in danger just so they can stay in the US. The US needs to concentrate on helping our citizens not people who are not from here.

I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persectution.  Some are fleeing war zones that are a direct result of US foriegn policies that are a direct cause of their woes.  We can't think that being the globes primary supplies of weapons does not cause an increase in refugees.
No, I don't support it. America is one of the worst places to live. I would tell them to flee somewhere else.

Yes, I support the government accepting refugees because these are people who are fleeing war or persecution. We should help people from other countries. The people that enter our country are hardworking and contribute in a positive way in America.

I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution, but will they in the months to come, gather those same refugees and place them at Alcatraz alley in Florida and treat them as if they are not human.
Accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution is the responsibility of the entire world. Yes they should accept more.

I am honestly torn on this topic; I'd say I am neutral. I think it sucks for refugees and they do need help, but this causes strain in the US and harms racial relations. I guess the US should only take a certain portion of refugees.

No I do not. We have millions of people here illegally and no one knows who they are. The system was seriously abused. I believe that all refugees fleeing war or persecution should seek refuge in China.
I am not educated enough on this topic to make a statement. I believe we should treat people as if they're human though.

Yes. I support the government accepting more refugees fleeing war or persecution. I believe that everyone has a right to seek safety and security, and that includes refugees from other places. I don't think it matters if a person comes illegally or not to a place. Boarders are something people drew and they should not be used to keep needy people in places that will kill them.
I believe that this depends on the situation. If there is a need to accept the refugees we should evaluate the situation carefully.

Yes, these people should be protected when it came to wars that they had no part of. It isn't right for them to stay in their country where they could be killed at any moment from bombs, missiles and guns.
Yes.  I believe our country should help refugees who are fleeing terrible conditions.  It's the right thing to do for humanity.

I do support it in most circumstances. Given the refugee crisis has been started in large part due to the ramifications of Western intervention during the Reagan, Bush and Obama administrations I think it's only fair, America is known as the land of accepting the tired and poor, right? Plus it'll help offset the incoming demographic crisis we're due to face in the coming decades.

I think there needs to be strict oversight of which refugees are accepted.  I think some refugees should be accepted into the US.  However, I think the US should also work with allies to spread refugees out to different companies.

Yes, I support accepting more refugees because we are a country of immigrants. Also, people should be free to seek asylum here in order to get away from the horrors of war. We are all people and should help each other.
Yes, I support the government accepting more refugees. I believe it is the morally right thing to do.
I support accepting more refugees. Our nation was built by immigrants and it's the right thing to do.
I do not accept this. I think this country does enough already for refugees.
I do. I am fine with refugees as long as they come in the front door. However I feel this should be null and void if they sneak in the country.
I only support acception more refugees under very specific conditions. If the refugees are Christians then by all means we should be accepting them otherwise, they can find some place else.

I support the government accepting more refugees. I do not believe it is fair or just to limit people based on where they were born. If somebody is fleeing their home and wants to take refuge here, good!
